intro: Peucedanum terebinthaceum var. deltoideum, commonly known as the Delta cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in temperate regions. Its aromatic seeds are used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and antispasmodic properties.
